title: How to Build a Penrose "Impossible" Triangle

steps.headline: Cut three boards.
steps.description: Each 8” long x 2” wide x ½” thick. Note that the size can be scaled up or down.

steps.headline: Attach boards.
steps.description: Use wood glue and clamps to apply pressure.

steps.headline: Drill holes and add bolts/screws.
steps.description: Note that these bolts are just used to give the illusion that the wood is connected.

steps.headline: Add weights to the back side of the bottom piece to allow the triangle to stand upright.
steps.description: Other options include adding a center axle under the bottom to allow it to spin or placing holes in the bottom side and providing a matching plate with dowel pins. The second option would allow you to reposition the triangle in the exact same spot (relative to camera or person) which would be nice for video.

steps.headline: Take a photo or make a video.
steps.description: A Canon DSLR camera was used for the photo and video. It took a few minutes on a tripod to line up the angles.
